Save the date for a workshop that helps refine your skills and keeps you informed.
Keep up with some of the latest happenings in the financial aid industry. National FFELP guarantor American Student Assistance® has designed a full day training event to discuss some of the hottest topics affecting financial aid offices!
Agenda:
8:30am Continental Breakfast 9:00am Emotional Intelligence 12:00pm Lunch 1:00pm Top Ten Financial Aid Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them 3:00pm Adjourn
Emotional Intelligence This workshop takes Emotional Intelligence into the workplace. Business leaders and outstanding performers are not defined by their IQs or even their job skills, but by their "emotional intelligence,” a set of competencies that distinguishes how people manage feelings, interact, and communicate. Analyses done by dozens of experts in 500 corporations, government agencies, and nonprofit organizations worldwide conclude that emotional intelligence is the barometer of excellence on virtually any job. We'll explain what emotional intelligence is and review its competencies and skills, including control of one's impulses, self-motivation, empathy, and social competence in interpersonal relationships.
Top Ten Financial Aid Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them
Are you aware of the most common pitfalls in the administration of financial aid? Join us in this session to learn about the most common errors that are made in the Financial Aid Office. Notification, funding, verification, regulatory issues hear about the most frequent errors and how to correct them. This course was created in response to client requests to American Student Assistance and feedback from training evaluation surveys. Walk away with a checklist to evaluate your institution and a resource list to guide your next steps.
